body.p: A series of machine code instructions are stored in RAM. Which of the following best describes the operation of the CPU?

multiple_choice.choice: The CPU compares the bytes of adjacent instructions to discover differing bits.
The CPU checks whether the instructions are correct
The CPU sets all the bytes to the value 42, which means "run."
The CPU swaps the instructions around, so the first is last and the last is first.
The CPU runs the first instruction, then the second, and so on.

response.feedback: The CPU uses instructions in RAM, but not for comparisons.
The CPU does not check the instructions. This should be done by the programmer or the compiler or both.
The CPU uses instructions in RAM, but not typically by changing them.
The CPU uses instructions in RAM, but not typically by rearranging them.
